results.title: The Home Planet
results.creator_credit: Barry Stoner and KCTS (Television station : Seattle, Wash.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Miracle Planet”.
The home planet is the final volume of “The miracle planet” series and looks at some of the major questions confronting the human race. With our population growing, the supply of our resources dwindling, our atmosphere threatened, and the spectre of malnutrition and starvation haunting more and more of the Earth’s population, what are the prospects for the planet continuing to support human life?

results.title: The Home made car
results.brief_description: Follows the rebuilding of an old Morris car in a home workshop, without commentary. The story of the man, his dog, and a dream which includes the girl next door, a torrid ten year old, a garage man and, of course, “the car”.

results.title: The Home buyers' bible
results.brief_description: Don’t be trapped when buying a home. Designed to prepare you for what will quite possibly be the most important purchase of your life. It prepares you with the information needed to protect yourself from problems whan buying a home, whilst also supplying information about what to do and where to go should you encounter difficulties after purchasing a home.

results.title: The Holy Year of 1950
results.creator_credit: Castle Films and United World Films
results.brief_description: St Peter’s Basilica setting for an inspiring series of religious functions in 1950. Pilgrims on their way to Rome attend the opening of the Holy Year 1950. Thousands of pilgrims attend open air mass in St Peter’s Square with Pope Pirest 12th. Shows the art and architecture of Rome.

results.title: The Holy Roman Empire
results.brief_description: Describes how an enormous section of western Europe was united under the idea of a single Christian government. Costumed re-enactments dramatize the division of powers and conflict between the popes and the emperors and the factors which led to the eventual decay of the Holy Roman Empire.

results.title: The Holy land: background for history and religion
results.brief_description: A picture of life in the Holy Land as background to the study of history and religion. Discusses its biblical history, its geography and its inhabitants, together with its significance in the lives of Christian peoples.

results.title: The Holy Innocents = Los Santos Inocentes
results.creator_credit: Julian Mateoas, Ganesh and Mario Camus
results.brief_description: The Holy innocents is a poignant rural drama zeroing in on the abysmal class differences still existing in some sections of modern Spain, especially in the holdings of the rural aristocracy. The story concerns an impoverished family working on the estate of an aristocratic family in the province of Extramaduna in the 1960s. Each of the members of the poor family is spotlighted for a part of the film.

results.title: The Hollywood Revue of 1929
results.brief_description: Hosted by Conrad Nagel and Jack Benny this film features many of the MGM contracted stars and performers in an all-out musical comedy revue staged in Hollywood in 1929. Includes such luminaries as Joan Crawford, Laurel and Hardy, John Gilbert, Norma Shearer, Buster Keaton, and Marie Dressler.

results.title: The Hollywood Palace
results.creator_credit: William Harbach, Zodiac Enterprises and Grey Lockwood
results.brief_description: The Hollywood Palace was a very popular long-running American variety show televised on Saturday nights from 1964-1970. Its success was mainly due to its high profile guests and variety of entertainment offered to its viewers along with the revolving core group of hosts including Sammy Davis Jr, Jimmy Durante, Don Adams, Fred Astaire, Judy Garland and the ever popular Bing Crosby. This video is a special edition of the final show hosted by Crosby which takes a look back at some of the most memorable moments with performances by Nat King Cole (“Unforgettable”), Fred Astaire and Ethel Merman (“Anything goes”), Judy Garland (“Be a clown”), Dean Martin (“Volare”), and many more. It also includes some great comedy sketches by such comedians as Jerry Lewis, Groucho Marx, Don Knots, Jack Benny, Debbie Reynolds, Phyllis Diller and Burns and Allen with some “behind-the-scenes” footage of rehearsals and bloopers by the stars. This is a travel down memory lane. An interesting footnote: the Rolling Stones made their first US TV appearance on the show in 1964. Due to the unique material contained in this program, variations may occur in picture and sound quality.
